extendedMetadata.name: Topic
extendedMetadata.value: The Microsociological Perspective: Social Interaction in Everyday Life

extendedMetadata.name: Objective
extendedMetadata.value: LO: 4.2: Explain the significance of social structure and its components: culture, social class, social status, roles, groups, and social institutions; compare the functionalist and conflict perspectives on social structure; and explain what holds society together.

config.question: A type of body language that could be used to discourage social interaction is __________.

choices.content: frowning and shaking your head side to side
laughing with friends while pointing at somebody
whistling and shaking your head up and down
talking in a hushed voice while shooing somebody away

answer_3.response: sider this: Sanctions are used by society to encourage members to conform to the social norms. Whistling and shaking your head up and down would likely encourage a certain behavior. LO 4.2 Explain the significance of social structure and its components: culture, social class, social status, roles, groups, and social institutions; compare the functionalist and conflict perspectives on social structure; and explain what holds society together.
